company.name: Forensics Consulting Solutions, LLC
company.business_description: An electronic discovery consulting firm that provides privacy and security services and participates in data protection frameworks.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. ยง 45(a)

complaint.factual_background: Forensics Consulting Solutions, an electronic discovery consulting firm, falsely claimed on its website that it was a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework from August 2012 until May 2015. In reality, the company had allowed its Safe Harbor certification to lapse in August 2012 and was marked as 'not current' by the U.S. Department of Commerce. The company continued to display statements on its website suggesting active participation in the Safe Harbor Framework despite no longer being certified.

representations_made.description: Claimed to be a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
representations_made.quoted_text: Through the means described in Paragraph 12, respondent represented, expressly or by implication, that it was a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework.

counts.title: False Safe Harbor Participation
counts.representation: The company represented that it was a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
counts.fact: Beginning in 2012, respondent was not a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 13 is false and misleading.

definitions.respondent: Forensics Consulting Solutions, LLC and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Commerce: as defined in Section 4 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. ยง 44.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy/Security Program Membership
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its membership in, adherence to, or participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or self-regulatory organizations, including the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent membership in or participation in privacy or security programs
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that respondent and its officers, agents, representatives, and employees, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service, in or affecting commerce, shall not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including, but not limited to, the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for five years all documents relating to compliance with this order.

requirements.description: Maintain for five years all advertisements and promotional materials containing representations covered by this order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall maintain and upon request make available to the Federal Trade Commission for inspection and copying, a print or electronic copy of, for a period of five (5) years from the date of preparation or dissemination, whichever is later, all documents relating to compliance with this order, including but not limited to: A. all advertisements, promotional materials, and any other statements containing any representations covered by this order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation;

requirements.description: Maintain for five years any documents that call into question compliance with this order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall maintain and upon request make available to the Federal Trade Commission for inspection and copying, a print or electronic copy of, for a period of five (5) years from the date of preparation or dissemination, whichever is later, all documents relating to compliance with this order, including but not limited to: B. any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that call into question respondent's compliance with this order.

provisions.title: Order Distribution and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to current and future personnel with relevant responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.

requirements.description: Deliver order to current personnel within 30 days after service of order
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent shall deliver this order to such current personnel within thirty (30) days after service of this order

requirements.description: Deliver order to future personnel within 30 days after they assume relevant positions or responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities

requirements.description: Obtain signed and dated acknowledgment statements within 30 days of delivery
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this order, within thirty (30) days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy of the order pursuant to this section.

provisions.title: Corporate Change Notification
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission within 14 days of any corporate changes that may affect compliance obligations.

requirements.description: Notify Commission within 14 days of corporate changes affecting compliance obligations
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall notify the Commission within fourteen (14) days of any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including, but not limited to: a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file compliance reports with the Commission within 60 days after service of the order and within 10 days of additional requests.

requirements.description: File initial compliance report within 60 days after service of order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent, and its successors and assigns, within sixty (60) days after the date of service of this order, shall file with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order.

requirements.description: Submit additional compliance reports within 10 days of written notice from Commission representative
requirements.quoted_text: Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission, it shall submit an additional true and accurate written report.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035 or twenty years from the most recent date of issuance or federal court complaint filing, whichever comes later.

requirements.description: Order remains in effect for 20 years from issuance or from most recent federal court complaint filing
requirements.quoted_text: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035 or twenty (20) years from the date of its issuance, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later

duration.termination_text: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035 or twenty (20) years from the date of its issuance, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Part in this order that terminates in fewer than twenty (20) years; B. this order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Part. Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that respondent did not violate any provision of the order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the order as to such respondent will terminate according to this Part as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal
